meanings.definition: glamorizers (noun): People or things that enhance the attractiveness or appeal of something.
meanings.sent1: The fashion designers were the glamorizers of the event, making everyone look stunning.
meanings.sent2: The makeup artist and hairstylist acted as glamorizers for the photoshoot.
meanings.sent3: The glamorizers transformed the plain room into a glamorous party venue.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a natural glamorizer, brightening up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The flowers served as the perfect glamorizers for the wedding decor.

meanings.definition: glamorizers (verb): To make something or someone more attractive or appealing.
meanings.sent1: She used makeup to glamorize her look for the special occasion.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team worked hard to glamorize the new product launch.
meanings.sent3: The chef glamorized the simple dish by adding a touch of gourmet presentation.
meanings.sent4: The artist glamorized the landscape by adding vibrant colors to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The interior designer knew how to glamorize any space with elegant decor.
